intro: Jurinea mollis f. erectobracteata, commonly known as the erect-bracteled sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and features dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in composite heads. It thrives in coastal environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. This variety is distinguished by its erect bracts, which give it a unique appearance compared to other forms of Jurinea mollis.
